question: How do you add a new individual member to a Resource Allocation Project (RAP) for general-purpose clusters?
answer: To add a new member, go to 'Add Members' and enter the CCRI of the user you want to add. Once added, the new member will be highlighted in yellow.

question: How can a PI add multiple sponsored users or co-PIs to a RAP for general-purpose clusters at the same time?
answer: If you add a new PI as a member, you can add any of their sponsored users or co-PIs at the same time by going to 'Add Members' and clicking on the 'In bulk' link.

question: What should a user do if the 'In bulk' option doesn't show the name of a user they want to add to a RAP?
answer: If the user is not listed, click on 'Cancel' to go back to the RAP membership page and return to the step of adding members individually by CCRI.

question: How is RAP membership represented and what does it define?
answer: RAP membership is represented as a group in LDAP, defining a group of users authorized to submit jobs against the RAPI (ID of the RAP) and share files within the same Unix group.

question: What option must users specify when submitting jobs to the scheduler on general-purpose clusters?
answer: Users will need to specify a group name as the value of the `--account` option.

question: How should jobs related to a RAC application be submitted on general-purpose clusters?
answer: Jobs pertaining to the research described in the RAC application should be submitted with the group name corresponding to the RAC award, e.g., `--account=rrg-profname-ab`.

question: How should jobs not related to a RAC application be submitted on general-purpose clusters?
answer: Jobs pertaining to other research should be submitted with the default group name, e.g., `--account=def-profname`.

question: What is recommended for transferring large amounts of data to an Alliance cluster for storage allocation?
answer: For substantial amounts of data, the use of Globus is strongly recommended.

question: How is a `/project` storage allocation created on a general-purpose cluster?
answer: A `/project` storage allocation on a general-purpose cluster is created as a directory of the form `/project/<group-name>`, e.g., `/project/rrg-profname-ab`, with an associated quota.

question: Where should files related to a RAC application be stored by sponsored users on general-purpose clusters?
answer: Files pertaining to the research described in the RAC application should be stored in the `/project/<group-name>` directory by all sponsored users.

question: What is the form of the default project space on general-purpose clusters?
answer: The default project space is of the form `/project/def-profname`.

question: When might a user want to move data from their default project space to an RRG or RPP `/project` directory?
answer: You may wish to move data if it pertains to the research described in the RAC application.

question: Who has default access to a RAC award on Niagara?
answer: By default, every role sponsored through your Alliance CCDB registration and any co-PIs listed on your RAC application have access to your RAC award on Niagara.

question: What are the initial steps to manage users for your Niagara allocation if you want to select specific users?
answer: Log in at https://ccdb.alliancecan.ca/ and from the 'My Account' menu, select 'Manage RAP Memberships'. Then, in the RAP drop-down list, select the RAP to which you want to add members.

question: How do you add an individual new member to a RAP for Niagara resources?
answer: To add a new member, go to 'Add Members' and enter the CCRI of the user you want to add. Once added, the new member will be highlighted in yellow.

question: What happens when a user submits a job to the scheduler on Niagara?
answer: When a user submits a job to the scheduler, the job will be assigned to the current allocation of the user's PI.

question: What must a user do if they belong to more than one PI or group when submitting a job on Niagara?
answer: If the user has more than one PI (or group), they must specify a group name as the value of the `--account` option.
